lines.text: Where's Sybil?
¿Que?
Where's Sybil?
Where's... the bill?
No, not a bill! I own the place!

[on the phone]
I know... I know... I know... Oh, I know!
Then why is she telling you?

[about Sybil's laugh]
Sounds like somebody machine-gunning a seal.
You'll have to forgive him. He's from Barcelona.
Your *name*, please, could I have your name?
Melbury.
[the phone rings; Basil picks it up]

[to Melbury]
One second please.
[to phone]

Hello?... Ah, yes Mr O'Reilly, well it's perfectly simple. When I asked you to build me a wall I was rather hoping that instead of just dumping the bricks in a pile you might have found time to cement them together... you know, one on top of another, in the traditional fashion.
[to Melbury, testily]
Could you fill it in, please?
[to phone]
Oh, splendid! Ah, yes, but *when*, Mr O'Reilly?
[to Melbury, who is having difficulty with the register]
there - there!
[to phone]
Yes, but when? Yes, yes... ah!... the flu!
[to Melbury]
*Both* names, please.
[to phone]
Yes, I should have guessed, Mr. O'Reilly that and the potato famine I suppose...
I beg your pardon?
Would you put *both* your names, please?...
[to phone]
Well, will you give me a *date*?
Er... I only use one.

[with a withering look]
You don't have a first name?
No, I am *Lord* Melbury, so I simply sign myself "Melbury".
[there is a long, long pause]

[to phone]
Go away.
[puts phone down]
... I'm *so* sorry to have kept you waiting, your lordship... I *do* apologize, *please* forgive me. Now, was there something, is there something, anything, I can do for you? Anything at all?
Polly, what's that smell?
Flowers, I just got them from the garden.
Well, what are you stinking the place up with those for? What's happened to the plastic ones?
Being ironed.
Do you remember when we were first *manacled* together? We used to laugh quite a lot.
Yes, but not at the same time, Basil.
[she leaves him alone]
Well, that was a warning, wasn't it? Zhoom! What was that? That was your life, mate. Oh, really, do I get another? No, that's your lot mate. Back to the World of dreams...
Manuel will show you to your rooms - if you're lucky.
Right, well I'll go and have a lie down then. No I won't; I'll go and hit some guests.
[Basil has accidentally set off the burglar alarm during the fire drill, guests start walking out of the building thinking it's the fire alarm, but Basil stops them all in the lobby]
Oh I thought that was the drill.
Yes there is, at twelve o'clock.
But, it is twelve o'clock.
Well not quite.
[to guests that try to leave]
Excuse me!
Well, I make it twelve o'clock.

[to guests]
Im afraid that wasn't the...
What time do you make it, Major?

[annoyed]
Look...
Burglars about, I think.
Look, it doesn't matter what time he makes it, it hasn't started yet.
What?
It hasn't started yet!
But, that was the bell wasn't it?
No!
He means the *drill* hasn't started yet.
What drill? We didn't hear a drill.

[trying to explain]
No, no no no, look, look - that was the burglar alarm.
See!
The burglar alarm?
Yes!
Are there burglars?
Evidently!
we have the fire drill when I ring the fire bell- That wasn't the fire bell!
Well, how are we supposed to know that wasn't the fire bell?
Because, it doesn't sound like the fire bell.
It did.
It didn't!
Next contestant, Mrs. Sybil Fawlty from Torquay. Specialist subject - the bleeding obvious.
And don't do anything *we* wouldn't do!
Oh, just a little breathing, surely.
Don't be alarmed, it's only my wife laughing.
I know nothing.
Coming my little piranha fish.
Have I ceased to exist?

[to Sybil, while having dinner]
Why don't you have another vat of wine, dear?
It's almost worth staying alive for little moments like that, isn't it Sybil? I know it's true because I read it on the back of a matchbox.

[Audrey's separated]
I think it's very sporting of Mrs Fawlty to go over there and listen to all that rubbish!
Salt of the Earth, couldn't live without her.
She's a fine woman, Mrs Fawlty.
No, I wouldn't go that far.
No, nor will I.
We have a Spanish porter at the moment, he's from Barcelona. It'd be quicker to train an *ape*!

[to Manuel]
Stupidissimo! Continental cretin!
So this Finnish floozy is your karate teacher is she?
Well. It's a sort of karate isn't it?
Is this a Hotel or isn't it?
Well, within reason.
Not pureeing your loved ones, that's the tricky part.
